reviewText:
Overall Score: 5/10
Pros:    Interesting game mechanics. The gun mechanics have been thought out well, and are quite different from other games. The rotating rooms and redirectors are an interesting challenge in themselves.
Nice graphics.
Fun puzzles.
Cheap. €3.49 at the time this was written. Even if you don't really like the game it's not a huge loss.
Cons:    Very short. 2 hours at most.
Controls feel slow. The gun doesn't follow your movements like in most games, but instead lags behind you a bit, making it feel disjointed. The jumping is also a bit dodgy. Half of the time I died was because I just walked into one of the pits without jumping.
Poor voice acting. I'm pretty sure this was just voiced by the developer, and the lackluster delivery makes the story seem bland and uninteresting.
Broken interactions/textures. While using the red sphere I managed to accidentally teleport myself out of the map and started falling into oblivion. Towards the end there is a blatantly missing floor that makes you wonder if you're going the wrong way.
No controller support. It really feels like the kind of game that would benefit from a controller.

reviewText: I bought this game because I was curious about the voice acting, to be honest. It was only $3.95 when I bought it so it wasn't that big of a deal. You can tell the actor is probably the dev or something but who cares. What you are left with after the in game dialog is a very clever game with interesting gravity mechanics. It is obiously inspired by portal but there is nothing new under the sun, so most games are like most games anymore. I recommend this game and in fact decided to try and beat it while doing a let's play after all. Cheers mates!!\n\nhttps://youtu.be/cz5Zy30v_Eg
